English:
Oh my, you're awake?
Welcome home, Yuuko!
Chinese:
哎呀，妳醒啦？
歡迎回來，小悠子★
Korean:
어머, 깼니?
어서 와♪ 유코♥
German:
Hoppla, du bist wach?
Willkommen zu Hause, Yuuko!

English: M-Miss Rie?!
Chinese: 里、里繪姊……
Korean: 리, 리에 씨…
German: F-Fräulein Rie?!

English:
You were controlling those monsters? Then that
means... every EDEN Syndrome case has been because
you...
Chinese:
是妳……操控那個怪物的嗎……？
這麼說，也是妳……害大家得到EDEN症候群……？！
Korean:
당신이, 그 괴물을 조종하고 있었던 건가요…?
그럼… EDEN 증후군도 전부 당신이…!?
German:
Sie haben diese Monster gesteuert?
Das heißt ja ... Alle Fälle von EDEN-Syndrom ...
sind wegen Ihnen passiert ...

English:
Oh, no.
I wasn't doing it all from the very beginning.
Chinese:
討厭啦～
並不是一開始就是人家做的唷！
Korean:
어머 싫어라~
처음부터 전부 내가 한 건 아니야
German:
Nicht doch.
Ganz am Anfang war ich es noch nicht.

English:
But I was fascinated by the existence of the
Eaters. I knew there was a way to control them if
only I looked hard enough!
Chinese:
不過侵食者實在太有吸引力，
所以我才想試試看能不能操縱它們！
Korean:
하지만 이터의 존재는 무척 매력적이었으니까
어떻게 조종할 수 없을까~ 하고 줄곧 시험해 보고 있었어
German:
Aber die Verschlinger haben mich fasziniert.
Ich wusste, irgendwie kann man sie beherrschen,
man muss es nur wollen!

English:
The experiments were a big success! All that's
left to do is to tear down the world's walls!
Chinese:
最後，實★驗★成★功～♪
接下來只要利用這個，打破這世界的圍牆就好囉♪
Korean:
실험은, 대♥성♥공~~♪
이제 이걸 이용해서, 세계의 벽을 없애는 것 뿐이야♪
German:
Die Experimente waren ein durchschlagender Erfolg!
Jetzt gilt es nur noch, die Mauern der Welt
einzureißen!

English:
And to do that, I'll need your mental data... Your
memories.
Chinese:
為了達到目的，我需要妳的精神資料，
也就是妳的“記憶”。
Korean:
그러기 위해서는, 너의 정신 데이터가―
"기억"이, 필요해
German:
Und dazu brauche ich deine Mentaldaten ...
Deine Erinnerungen.

English: Work with me just a little bit longer, dear Yuuko!
Chinese: 小悠子，妳願意再幫我一個小．忙．吧★
Korean: 유코, 조금만 더 협 력 해 줘♥
German:
Mach nur noch ein klein wenig länger mit,
liebe Yuuko!

English:
!!!
Oh my. It's you.
Chinese:
！！
哎呀，你是？
Korean:
!!
…어머? 너는
German:
!!!
Oha. Du wieder.

English:
Looks like your annoying little friend followed
you back.
Chinese: 麻煩的小蟲也跟來了啊～
Korean: 방해하는 벌레가 붙어 있었구나~
German:
Deine nervtötende Begleitung ist dir offenbar
gefolgt.

English:
That ability of yours is getting to be a tad bit 
bothersome. Would you mind getting out my hair?!
Chinese:
你的能力有點棘手耶。
可以請你先滾一邊去嗎～！！
Korean:
네 능력은 좀 성가셔
지금은 다른 데로 좀 가 줄래~!!
German:
Dein kleiner Trick wird mir langsam arg lästig.
Würdest du dich bitte vom Acker machen?

English: There, now that that nuisance is out of the way...
Chinese: 好了，這下就不會有人來礙事了～
Korean: 자 그럼, 이걸로 방해꾼은 사라졌네~
German: So, jetzt, wo dieses Ärgernis beseitigt ist ...

English: Miss Rie!
Chinese: 里繪姊……！！
Korean: 리에 씨…!!
German: Fräulein Rie!

English:
Now, now, you mustn't move!
You have to relax for your first time, remember?
Chinese:
哎呀！不・可・以・亂動喔！
第一次要放輕鬆才行唷。
Korean:
어머, 움직이면 안 돼!
처음 할 때는, 힘을 빼야지… 응?
German:
Na, na, nicht bewegen!
Du sollst dich doch nur entspannen!

English:
What's great about this terminal is that not only
can I log into EDEN with any avatar I want...
Chinese:
這個裝置真正厲害的地方呀，
可不只是能用“自由製作的化身”登入EDEN喔！
Korean:
이 장치의 굉장한 점은, "자유롭게 작성한 아바타"로
EDEN에 로그인을 할 수 있는 것… 만이 아니야!
German:
Über dieses fabelhaften Terminal kann ich mich
nicht nur mit jedem beliebigen Avatar in EDEN
einloggen ...

English:
It creates the personality, and imports it as
memories into the Digital World.
Chinese:
它還可以創造整個人格，
以“記憶”的方式，帶進電腦世界裡……
Korean:
인격 그 자체를 크리에이트해서
"기억"으로서 전뇌세계에 가져간 후, 적용하는 게 가능해…
German:
Er erschafft auch die Persönlichkeit und
importiert sie als Erinnerungen in die Digitale Welt.

English: Did you not catch on, dear Yuuko?
Chinese: 小悠子，妳有沒有發現呀？
Korean: 유코, 알고 있었어?
German: Klingelt’s noch nicht, liebe Yuuko?

English:
You thought you were the real Yuugo when you were
logged in as Yuugo? But no. I created that
personality.
Chinese:
妳以YUGO的身份登入EDEN時，
妳就是真正的YUGO了！不過這個人格是我創造出來的！
Korean:
네가 유고로서 EDEN에 로그인하고 있을 때
넌 진짜 유고였던 거라구? 내가 만든 인격으로서, 말이야
German:
Du dachtest, du bist der echte Yuugo, wenn du als
Yuugo eingeloggt bist? Nicht doch. Diesen
Charakter habe ich erschaffen.

English: N-No. That was of my own free will...
Chinese: 才、才不是！我是以自己的意志——
Korean: …아, 아니야, 난 스스로의 의지로――
German: N-Nein. Das habe ich freiwillig ...

English:
Your own *free will*?
There's hardly any of that left.
Chinese:
小悠子的意志？
根本沒有那種東西～
Korean:
유코의 의지?
그런 건 거의 없었어~
German:
Freiwillig?
Von deinem freien Willen ist nicht viel übrig.

English:
If your free will was in charge, you'd never have
taken part in that farce to fool all those
hackers.
Chinese:
不然就算妳再怎麼會演，
也不可能騙過那些駭客呀！
Korean:
그렇지 않고서야, 아무리 네가 연기를 잘한다고 해도
그만큼의 해커들을 속일 수 있을 리 없잖아
German:
Wenn du frei handeln könntest, hättest du nie
mitgemacht bei der Falle für die ganzen Hacker.

English:
To fool... the hackers?
I did that... to those hackers?
Chinese:
騙了那些駭客？
我……騙了他們？
Korean:
해커들을… 속였어?
내, 내가… 해커들을…?
German:
Falle ... für die Hacker?
Ich habe ... den Hackern das angetan?

English:
Hee hee! In other words, this terminal can spoof
your memories via the Digital World!
Chinese:
呵呵，也就是說，
這個裝置能夠透過電腦世界竄改“記憶”★
Korean:
후훗, 즉 이 장치는
전뇌세계를 통해 "기억"을 뜯어고칠 수 있다는 거야♥
German:
Hihi! Anders gesagt kann dieses Terminal über
die Digitale Welt deine Erinnerungen simulieren!

English: It can write them in and, of course, extract them.
Chinese: 既然能夠寫入記憶，當然也能取出來……
Korean: 새로 써넣는 것도 가능하고, 물론, 빼내는 것도 말이야…
German:
Ich kann sie eingeben und natürlich auch wieder
extrahieren.

English:
Well, then, shall we begin?
I'm going to steal allllll your secrets!
Chinese:
那我們就開始吧！
把小悠子的“記憶（秘密）”……全部奪走♪
Korean:
그럼, 시작해 볼까
유코의 "기억(비밀)"을…… 빼앗아 버릴 거야♪
German:
Nun denn, wollen wir?
Ich hole mir aaalle deine Geheimnisse!

English: Ahhh... Nnnnnnngh! Nnngaaaaaaaaahhhh!
Chinese: 嗚啊啊……啊啊啊啊———！！
Korean: 아아아…… 으으―――으아아아―――!!
German: Ahhh ... Nngh! Aaaah!
